unnormalised: Okay, so you're thinking of flying within India, huh? Let's talk airways. I've flown a bunch, from the swanky IndiGo to the budget SpiceJet, and even the sometimes-delayed Air India. It’s a whole adventure, let me tell you!
normalised: Okay, so you are thinking of flying within India, huh? Let us talk airways. I have flown a bunch, from the swanky I-N-D-I-G-O to the budget SpiceJet, and even the sometimes-delayed Air India. It is a whole adventure, let me tell you!

unnormalised: First off, let's be real, price matters. I usually start my hunt on sites like MakeMyTrip or Yatra. They compare all the airlines, showing you the fares from ₹2500 to ₹8000 depending on the route and time of year. Keep an eye out for flash sales, especially around holidays like Diwali. I once snagged a Delhi-Mumbai flight for just ₹2000 during a monsoon offer!
normalised: First off, let us be real, price matters. I usually start my hunt on sites like MakeMyTrip or Yatra. They compare all the airlines, showing you the fares from rupee two thousand five hundred to rupee eight thousand depending on the route and time of year. Keep an eye out for flash sales, especially around holidays like Diwali. I once snagged a Delhi-Mumbai flight for just rupee two thousand during a monsoon offer!

unnormalised: IndiGo is generally my go-to. Their planes are usually clean, they’re pretty much always on time (at least 90% of the time according to their website!), and their staff is friendly. Plus, they have a crazy number of flights, so you can usually find a timing that works. I flew IndiGo flight 6E203 from Bengaluru to Kolkata last year, and it was smooth sailing.
normalised: I-N-D-I-G-O is generally my go-to. Their planes are usually clean, they are pretty much always on time (at least ninety percent of the time according to their website!), and their staff is friendly. Plus, they have a crazy number of flights, so you can usually find a timing that works. I flew I-N-D-I-G-O flight six E two zero three from Bengaluru to Kolkata last year, and it was smooth sailing.

unnormalised: SpiceJet is the budget king. If you're willing to prepone your travel by a day or two and pack light to save on baggage fees, you can score some incredible deals. Just be prepared for potential delays. I think my flight SG304 from Hyderabad to Goa was delayed by 2 hours.
normalised: SpiceJet is the budget king. If you are willing to prepone your travel by a day or two and pack light to save on baggage fees, you can score some incredible deals. Just be prepared for potential delays. I think my flight S-G three zero four from Hyderabad to Goa was delayed by two hours.

unnormalised: Air India, ah, Air India. It’s the OG, the Maharaja! While they’ve been working to improve things, they still have their moments. My flight AI405 from London (LHR) to Delhi on 16/03/2023 was a mixed bag. The food was good, but the in-flight entertainment system was glitchy. And they have strict baggage allowance.
normalised: Air India, ah, Air India. It is the O-G, the Maharaja! While they have been working to improve things, they still have their moments. My flight A-I four zero five from London (L-H-R) to Delhi on sixteenth March two thousand and twenty three was a mixed bag. The food was good, but the in-flight entertainment system was glitchy. And they have strict baggage allowance.

unnormalised: Then there's Vistara, if you want a bit more luxury. They offer premium economy and business class, so if you're looking to splurge, Vistara is your airline. Their service is excellent, and their planes are newer. Although, their Delhi to Mumbai flights can cost upwards of Rs. 10000 sometimes.
normalised: Then there is Vistara, if you want a bit more luxury. They offer premium economy and business class, so if you are looking to splurge, Vistara is your airline. Their service is excellent, and their planes are newer. Although, their Delhi to Mumbai flights can cost upwards of rupees ten thousand sometimes.

unnormalised: Pro tip: Always book your flights at least 1 month in advance, especially if you're traveling during peak season. And seriously, download the airline apps. They make checking in and tracking your flight so much easier. For example, IndiGo app provides real-time updates on flight status and offers web check-in.

They make checking in and tracking your flight so much easier. For example, I-N-D-I-G-O app provides real-time updates on flight status and offers web check-in.

unnormalised: No matter which airline you choose, flying in India is an experience. Embrace the chaos, grab a chai at the airport, and enjoy the ride. Happy travels!
